page.title: 15Employment - Eglwysbach
page.content: In 1985 half of the houses in the village are occupied by Pensioners. As a result, the number of villagers who are employed is small. In olden days the villagers were either craftsmen or they worked on local farms or at the Bodnant Estate. Most of the people now working travel by car to Dolgarrog Aluminium Works or to Colwyn Bay or Llandudno. There are only a few farm workers today. The Bodnant Estate still employ a number of men as gardeners and ladies to help with the catering facilties. Most of the young people enter Llandrillo Technical College when they leave school but when they qualify they must leave the district to find work. Young people who pursue a College education have little hope of returning to their native village. Some people come to the area to establish businesses.
